snippet: The United States Preventive Services Task Force recommended that healthy postmenopausal women not take low doses of vitamin D and calcium.
abstract: United States Preventive Services Task Force recommends that healthy postmenopausal women should not take low doses of vitamin D supplements or calcium to prevent fractures.
lead_paragraph: The United States Preventive Services Task Force recommended that healthy postmenopausal women not take low doses of vitamin D and calcium.

headline.seo: Calcium and Vitamin D Ineffective for Fractures, U.S. Preventive Services Task Force Says
headline.main: Healthy Women Advised Not to Take Calcium and Vitamin D to Prevent Fractures
headline.print_headline: Healthy Women Advised Not to Take Calcium and Vitamin D to Prevent Fractures

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
